QYsGu-e42mYp5OGwVAhlfQ.text: We have been eating here for 5 years and I'm sad to say the food has become greasy and the recent price increase is ridiculous.  3 dishes, no egg rolls with and only rice with 2 for $40.54 is just not good.  Also this was carry out with no drinks.

zbnQ_OqpyQ3qmPQ10DE4-A.text: A little bit pricey but the food is incredible. Best Crab Rangoon I HAVE EVER HAD. I don't think I have ever ordered anything from here that isn't good. Try the Bento Box!

psIM7otonfk-Dq-dRRO5Ag.text: Been here many, many times. Liked it a lot when they first opened. Good sushi, but they have become very inconsistent with the rest of the dishes on the menu. It's gotten to where we get a good meal only about 30 to 40% of the time and now usually leave disappointed. Money is best spent elsewhere.

wdA0rt0MtMyPqaJwS_OiEg.text: It was average in atmosphere. Not busy or even steady for lunch on a weekend. The hostess and waiter appeared they wanted to be elsewhere every time I have gone. I can cook better than this place. So this is a definitely will never do again. I'd rather do fast food to get by instead, not a place to take a first date or any date.

PjiLVsdbSTjpq7YTqWZABw.text: This used to be my preferred chinese food spot, but quality seems to have really diminished. Don't get me wrong, it's still light years better than many places, but it just isn't the same anymore. Kinda like Ladainian Tomlinson.  This location is clean, modern and nicely decorated.  If you haven't been, Red Bowl is a fusion gourmet style asian restaurant. Prices are a couple bucks cheaper than PF Changs but preparation here is a little more traditional.   Since it's fusion, you can get everything from Generals Tso's, to Thai Basil Chicken, to Sushi and even Singaporean noodles.  Red Bowl is still good, it just isn't great anymore. But their $5 lunch specials with tea, now that's greatness.

dBzXI-ma_v3EKzaxH6fzjA.text: I'd say 3-3.5 stars, but there isn't much other good food in the area.  Sushi is good and asian fusion dishes are decent.  Lunch special is worth checking out, but I wouldn't drive out of my way for this place.

AP136tqSjahJl0t835v7tQ.text: I love this place for their sushi. I usually have the Crunchy Roll, Red Bowl, and the Spider Roll. The sushi tastes fresh and some of the best I've ever had. Additionally, sushi is offered at a special price ($3.99) on Wednesdays! The dining area is warm, cozy, and offers a nice environment to conversate with friends and loved ones. I really enjoy eating here and always ask for Krystal as my waitress. She is overly eager to please and my tips always reflect her service. The only drawback about this place is that it can get busy and you may wait a few moments longer to be seated at times. Other than that, excellent bistro!

RbUv6Y3JroornNsi9VcAcQ.text: Prices were reasonable, but the food not that impressive. Sushi roll didn't have much fish in it, and the bourbon chicken was only ok, and would have better if had more veggies, like broccoli, etc.  It still gets 3 stars because for a cheap chain one doesn't have high expectations.

32qZowvudAs11f7Pg8cpfw.text: We go once or twice every couple of months. The food quality is pretty consistent and what you would expect for a place like this. I have never gotten a dish that i was disappointed about. The Singapore street noodles are great and the egg drop soup is fantastic. We can get out with a family of 3 1/2 and pay less then $30. A+ in my book!

PM1fSLDagebMydHtJ9eYmQ.text: Very tasty compared to the other Asian restaurants in the area.. They are probably the best. Not the cheapest by far but def the best quality. Inside is nice and customer service is good but not a good place to pick up Chinese food and take home for the family. It will end up costing too much. Eating inside and enjoying the venue is better.

BcnIwaQZ-SS-GjiPV_Tp0g.text: This place is very convenient to my house so I stopped in one day to check it out. Ever since then i keep going back. The place is never super packed so you don't have to wait too long to get a table and the service is spot on. I only had to ask once for anything i needed and the refills/replacements kept coming without me saying a word. That to me is great service and means an excellent tip! The bento boxes are such a great deal and the food is delicious! Very flavorful and healthy portions. Try the egg drop soup, it's perfect! I always leave stuffed and have never been disappointed. They have amazing sushi specials and the sushi is fresh and taste great! i hope more people check this place out because I'm sure it's a little underrated compared to the more popular places uptown.

5Y0KqneoKINePAzmo9tmoQ.text: We had a terrible lunch here. In my opinion the beef was not really beef, something very fatty I've never tasted before. I returned it for the chicken which was not good either. My husbands scallop meal consisted of one scallop sliced very thin into four pieces. The manager did not care about our experience, if he/she would have cared they would have asked. Would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. Very disappointed!

HnGJ2CLAezCYj8PDGKzVmA.text: I genuinely like Red Bowl. Everytime I go to eat there my food is fantastic. I always get a bento box with california roll, mongolian beef, miso soup, and brown rice. The service is always a little slow but most of the waitstaff is really nice.  Last night however I ordered takeout. I ordered the mongolian beef, my favorite, and the curry shrimp, my moms favorite. When I got home I realized my mongolian beef didnt even LOOK like it did when I dined in. Not saucy and it didnt have as much flavor. My mom said that her curry shrimp was normally not as runny as it was either. So I guess this place is PERFECT for dine in up don't order to go because they dont seem to care as much about the food then!

Q94R0SkkE7KqmV2bqUIAGw.text: The best way to put it is, this place is what it is. Its super cheap and you get what you pay for. At least they have a full bar!! If you want take out type Chinese that has a little better quality then regular Chinese take out joints than this is your place. I will definitely go back and recommend that you try it at least once. Its the best place to go for Chinese if you don't want to spend a lot of money or if you don't feel like being over crowded at Pf Changs.

H0d9dLqz-rpzyXFZO1gSKg.text: This place is okay given the location and that there isn't any other real options unless you want to drive out of mountain island area. I have had their sushi which is good, but nothing special. Their chinese dishes are lacking heat. Location is the only reason I gave it 3 stars.

gFvcaEtNUM6nxHwukoOwIA.text: i like this place 1. bc is close to my house 2. is cheap 3. they have thai&japanese&and chinese food all together and the combo box is cheap compares to pf.chang and others asian places around charlotte.  i like the stuff they're really helpful. i will be back again soon

uTfJ5hCkgrBGGU-F-OImZA.text: We hadn't visited this location in quite sometime. Went there Tuesday, 1/8/13, no wait time to be seated. For 15 minutes, no one came to our table to get drink orders.....absolutely nothing! After waiting a few more minutes, we got up and walked out. WILL NOT BE BACK!!!

5nX5r77-qbcgH4fwGDvDkA.text: The general tso chicken is awesome. I also loved the Singapore noodles and their house rice!

_RvLoHmuuMQIw4Z3rQjuFg.text: This is our go-to place in the Mt. Island area!  The service has always been great and prompt. My wife loves their sushi selection. I'm fond of the bento box, which is a great deal. Their sushi is very well prepared. Their grill/wok items are so fresh and well cooked, you'd think you were paying double what your bill comes to.   The atmosphere is great. Good lighting, almost like a good kept secret tucked away next to Harris Teeter. We can't recommend this enough.

8pTo69MQZxx6r-UECujskg.text: To start on a positive, the prices are great! The service is fantastic.  However, the sushi is mediocre. I would compare it to what you can get at the grocery store. So if you aren't a sushi snob, this place is worth heading to. If you are, come anyway but order something else.

gwScwFJDWQ8b2UuSR_Bdgg.text: Love it here! I have been coming for a couple of years and it never disappoints. Hot n sour soup, Pad thai and red chicken curry are my favorite! Friendly service &  nice ambience

qt5Vb0ov3i3qbTfQmPfCfA.text: Not bad for take out. Decent prices, staff is always nice. Only complaint (not really) is that when I tell them spicy they never really make it spicy. I guess American spicy? Generals chicken is good as is wonton soup. Bang bang shrimp was gross but I didn't realize it had spicy mayo on it. I hate mayo :(.

u8Afe7NQaVHEM3vMoKfumQ.text: N.B.  The prices shown on their website-- and on their Take Out flyer-- are for Lunch only. At dinner time the price almost doubles.  Since I haven't been to lunch, I have no idea if the portions are also doubled or if you get more protein with your entree at that price.    Food was just okay.  Not memorable, except for the surprise when the bill was presented.

EeCi69JkGcbXuo_pK54kOw.text: Really not impressed with this place..It's over priced for the quality of food you get. I have been here 2 times just to give it a second chance. The sushi is subpar. If you remember the commercial about gas station sushi and not eating it, thats how I feel about this place.. The food is not that great also. It's doused in sauce and thats all you taste. I wont be coming back to this place.

I1Tceed14XAgUx65qFfrWQ.text: I went to Red Bowl the first week they opened and have been a semi-regular patron for all these years.  The quality has been up and down over that period of time but mostly wavered between 3 and 4 stars with a brief, early foray into 5 star territory.  I have not written a review, mostly because I thought I had already reviewed them which turns out not to be the case.  A couple of less than stellar meals recently have made me put pen to paper, or finger to laptop key in this case to give my opinion of this long-lived Westside restaurant.  I remember when this space was a hardware store, so I have a long history here but I will limit my comments to the most recent visit.  My wife and I ordered takeout from Red Bowl for dinner and the ladies at the front desk were efficient, and very nice as always.  They have never messed up our order and are always very close in the estimated time for the food to be ready.  Aside from one "creepy" waiter, all the staff are usually nice when I have sat in the dining room.  The food...We got potstickers which were limp, not fried, and cool to the touch.  The dipping sauce was right out of the fridge cold.  The eggroll was cool, not fried nearly enough, limp, and worst of all tasted like old grease.  Hot and sour soup was a hit, great balance, hot and spicy with lots of goodies.  House Lo Mein had a good flavor and was hot but the noodles were too soft, and the shrimp was way overcooked.  Beef and broccoli was about as good as you get at the average buffet, beef was tender and flavorful but too much sauce and very salty.  I hate to see this place go down hill but with the great number of good Chinese restaurants in this city, I refuse to go down hill with them.

kfU3u2NzYetL7eH1wnUJzw.text: I love Red Bowl and the food here. I've never had a negative experience until today. Tell me how much sense this makes. I was going to get a bento box which includes an appetizer, sushi roll, entree, and rice. I asked if I could get the sushi roll deep fried and the girl says no but you can get it deep fried if its not in the bento box. The difference is we have to send it from the sushi bar back to the chef. Um...wouldn't you need to send both back to the chef?  So she goes to check on it with another waitress comes back and says yes you can do that on the bento box but it costs $1 extra. REALLY?!?!?  What logic is that???  I can understand if they're hurting me for money or if there was an ingredient addition or change but really?!?

nG3jfNcEd5IMhS3RChAQwg.text: We always get take out and are never disappointed. They seem to knock it out of the park everytime!! Some of our favorites are mongolian beef, wonton soup, pad thai and the sushi.

4dzr-fD9DrSA_6IqNEWR0A.text: I really enjoy this location and everyone is always very friendly, especially the bartender. However, I was not as impressed tonight (Labor Day 2016) because the male host did not seem very friendly. I work in restaurants and he just didn't have good customer service for what I am used to here. I would still recommend though because I think (I hope) maybe it was just an off night for him.

nqy_qY5EZx0EjkA4QGgHzg.text: We had a good lunch here today. My biggest disappointment was the little pepper icon that let you know if a meal is supposed to be hot/spicy really let me down. My Red Curry Chicken was delicious, but a pretty mildly spiced curry sauce. It had zucchini and probably a whole onion worth of onion. No complaints at $5 with a tea, spring roll and fried rice. This was our first trip here and seems like a decent lunch stop if you're planning on getting groceries at Harris Teeter or the Walmart and don't want to shop on an empty stomach.   Their menu had plenty of choices that peaked our interest, but i'm guessing the $5 General Tso's is next on my list. If we do come back for dinner, i'll finally get to use that coupon in the Entertainment book.

zCkXyAHPCneBEUEr-LBzMA.text: It is delicious, consistent and a great atmosphere! I go there like once a week yum!!!

vO1vyFP8SDO6r1hIbK4LTw.text: I really love coming here when I get a craving for some Asian cusine!!  A friend told me about this place years ago and I have been going for about 8 years or so.  And since it is on our side of town that's a bonus!  Have tried many different things on the menu.  And have enjoyed them all.  Everyone is always so friendly when they greet you and wait on you.  We particullary like Eddie!  Always happy :)  We have also been to 2 of the other ones.  The one in Cary and Burlington.  They are also very nice.

tdk-6RUz8ZrXL6PskOedRg.text: I've been to 3 different Red Bowl's and I've decided this is my go-to place for a quick, consistent Asian dish.  Each location seems to do a great job with creating specials like Bento boxes for $11, 3 piece rolls for $3, and half price sushi after 8pm.  I like a good sushi deal and that fits the bill for me.  Service is hit and miss depending on the location but this one in particular seemed to be just fine even though they seemed a bit understaffed.  I've noticed that places that require their waiters or waitresses to bus their own tables seem to have slower service.  Hmmm.....  In short, Red Bowl is a solid option for a quick bite when you are trying to avoid drive through fast food, etc.

DZOMpKon5rbxcBtTNXzVlg.text: I go here often and really enjoy the blend of japanese and chinese cuisine. The food is excellent, but the service can be sketchy depending on who you get. Also, don't order an expensive bottle of wine. We did, and it tasted like vinegar. The manager would not provide us with a different bottle so it just sat there full. I've asked to return a bottle of wine perhaps twice in my entire lifetime, so I don't make a habit of doing so. Was very disappointed with the response we got that night.

pWqJJ-JTRjW3GLQqR9o90A.text: The menu is a little overwhelming, but they have a separate bento box menu which is easy to navigate and you get so much food for $12. The restaurant, while in a shopping center, is nice. Its a good middle of the road restaurant when you want Asian food but you don't want to pay a fortune and you don't want cheap Chinese.

kDVO_lAVlqQyHOM1U5Eajg.text: Not the best, not the worse. Red Bowl fills that need for decent take-out which we get more than dine-in. They could step it up a notch with better quality sushi but they haven't and probably won't. Mongolian Beef, Calamari are the main reasons I go back. Also, they're in the area so convenience can trump the medium quality meals. I'm glad they're here!

4071sfvWHzJ-nK-beIvuoA.text: I ordered take out today and made my order and was told it would take 15-20 minutes.  I arrived at the restaurant at about the 25 minute mark.  I checked in and paid and was told it would be a couple more minutes.  10 more minutes went by and I asked again what was taking so long.  The girls looked at each other and then went back to the kitchen.  At the 15 minute mark the girls came back up and were talking to each other.  I could tell by their body language something was off.  I asked them, did you give my food away to someone else?  They looked at each other and said they didn't know.  I then asked for a manger.  John came up and I pulled him aside out of ear shot of anyone else and explained my disappointment.  I asked him to knock off half my bill due to my food being given away and he reluctantly comped my entire order.  I was so happy!  He said it would take about 15 minutes.  He credited back my $40 bill and then came back 5 minutes later asking if I wanted some water or a beer.  I said a beer would be great.  John was amazing.  He is what all managers should strive to be.  Standing up when a restaurant messes up and fixing the relationship!  I was so happy with how John treated me.  I will never hesitate to come back to Red Bowl.  When and if they mess up, they will admit it, and fix it.  Thank you so much John, the food was amazing!

v4qW66ZEX4vxGBzbszJ8LA.text: I arrived at 9:37 but they stopped seating at 9:30pm. The lady at front desk seemed unapologetic and did not seem interested in our business.

qsmb676vgkX3QaBtq13PUw.text: Not impressed...had a Bento Box -- based on reviews.  General Tso' Chicken was nothing but fried batter with sauce, the egg roll and "fried" rice were mushy. Sushi roll was OK, nothing special.  Our waitress came across disengaged, not sure if she lacked confidence or hated her job.

Gg2GEU9T72Gvhij3mzjUQw.text: The shrimp fried rice is awesome and only been here 3 times but the sushi has been great. If you are local to the Denver area it's worth stopping in.

rZ7liXg_dYoj16D7v_-44A.text: Not sure about the rest of the food but the hibachi bowl (chicken & shrimp) was soo salty I couldn't eat it. Boyfriend bit into a piece of chicken and said it tasted like it was injected with saline. He said his sushi rolls were OK. Won't be back.

XA5kGl-uM5vR8j2UzmnWZw.text: I was so disappointed in this place! Spent over $30 on a takeout order and ended up throwing it all in the trash after a few bites! Tasteless and mushy were the only two words that came to mind. Didn't seem like salt was even used, much less any other seasonings.

SnFoMDlr4QxCxTVFzWOzvg.text: I've eaten here 5-6 times and honestly I've been underwhelmed. The food tastes like imitation Chinese food or something. It's like it's almost good but it's just not.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bento Box

o8cyQ0JLkkI3bfcO3ocykg.text: My friend and I stopped here for dinner. I was a little turned off after the very unenergetic/annoyed hostess begrudgingly walked us over to our booth. Seriously?! Get it together!!!  Our waiter made up for the poor first impression. He was prompt and funny and made some good recommendations. We both went with the Bento Box which offers your choice of soup or salad, sushi roll, entree and fried or steamed rice.   I went with the Hot and Sour soup. It had all the flavors I was expecting and the crispy wontons added a nice touch. For my sushi roll, I opted for the Spicy Tuna Roll. It was classic. But it didn't knock my socks off.  Finally for the entree I went with the Spicy Mango Shrimp with steamed rice. The shrimp were large and the mango sauce was good.   This place isn't bad my any means, I just wasn't overly impressed. I may give them another chance if I'm in the area, but I'm not rushing back.

-bp1rChNrHA_lKvv8SM_7w.text: Food is predictable but not great. The red curry chicken is probably the best thing on the menu.  We have spent a lot of money here over the years because it's convenient and close and there are not many options this side of town.  Sushi is tolerable, but expense for what you get (e.g $4.50) for two pieces of nigiri salmon. They need to get new tables as the tables always feel sticky. Luckily we have never gotten sick from eating here. Hope more restaurants come to mountain island lake.

EIQiVBKnuT31xBxA7ZkYcw.text: I tried to order take out but kept getting put on hold with barely a greeting. I called three times and was put on hold for over 5 minutes each time before just showing up. When I did arrive, they were not busy at all, most of the restaurant was empty. The young lady who took my order was nice and went to get the bartender so that I could have a drink while waiting on my food. He finally appeared, went to the couple at the end of the bar (walking by me) and then talked to a few others, walked by me AGAIN and left. No service. The lady taking the orders even noticed. The food was OK. I tried something new. Likely won't go back.

rv_xx3WX62MB3eaGh4k7fA.text: I like coming here for the sushi that is fresh and alot of selections to choose from, but the restaurant is stifling hot- for some reason the owner does not like to turn it down to make it comfortable for the patrons as well as the staff- it's not like a recent A/C issue with the unit, it has always been this warm from the get- go ( several years now) Other than that, if you like sushi in a "tropical climate " than you're good to go-

3wLL8UdZu-8DwyfkRE05-Q.text: Go often food is alway good. They have a diverse menu and the service is great. I enjoy the bento box as you get a complete meal including sushi for a reasonable price.

5QSz8YzpkjUMIm6bjZO81w.text: Came here during lunch hours and it wasn't really busy, but for some reason it took 15 minutes before I got any service. Two people walked in after me and got service before me. The food is ok, nothing spectacular. I use to love this spot, but they've fallen off.

yDgtbiGruEp8ksOLHa63Ww.text: Very disappointed. Went here for a last minute birthday dinner. I ordered a spicy tuna sushi roll for an appetizer and the mango chicken for my main course. The sushi was awful. It tasted as if it had been sitting for hours and not fresh at all. My chicken was undercooked and cold. And my steamed rice was crispy and cold. The wait staff was more concerned with cleaning up for the night than they were being our servers and the store had plenty of time left for closing.

LQp8egZCHMy_fOipaMV-8g.text: Came in for dinner on a Monday night. Ordered a martini, it was not received till after I got my dinner which was cold veggies.... The avocado rolls are pathetic in size. Save your money, fast china is better than this place.

cz02B2t-EUDSDZ0r7iz4KA.text: I love this place. My husband and I go here at least 3x a week. They have daily specials. I love Thursdays...definitely go check it out!!

WA2z07wGP-SW1ZKQ9lKJww.text: I usually get the General Tso's Chicken. It's excellent and always very tender. The atmosphere is good and the service is great as well.

w9rSqiNuk6hH1uRTTAahqw.text: Terrible experience tonight, ordered food as we walked out from Disney on ice at time warner arena because we wanted to stop and grab it quickly to get the kids home in bed.... Informed it would be 20-25 minutes but more like 20 minutes. We arrived and paid and was told 5 more minutes. 10 minutes later no food and at this point our food had been called in 35 minutes, we ask for refund. Of course a manager had to process the refund transaction, so the lady calls for a manager then proceeds to take other customers orders, the manager walks up and I guess they only have one computer, so we are still waiting... Waiting without food and without a refund.... I looked at my husband and said we can dispute the charge with the bank. So 40 minutes later no food that we paid for and no refund. They didn't even offer us the rice that was ready for our order.

yZZDNcm68IzoWdgDOimOcw.text: I like coming here when I'm craving for Chinese and am on my boyfriend's side of town. The place is nice and I like their big booths. The servers are pretty nice and quick with things also. I like most of the foods that I've ordered but the house fried rice that my little sister ordered, in my opinion is a waste of money it's nothing special. Other Chinese restaurants make better fried rice so just don't order that. Everything else is fine.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spider roll
Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bento box

dfKkGPBlqr681KLdSut8AQ.text: More buffet quality, than cooked to order.  I've never been impressed.  Find yourself a family owned "New York Style Chinese" restaurant and you'll be much happier.    If you're looking for a half step above mall food court chinese, then this is your place.  But who wants that kind of experience?  Not I.

VTR5IA13NYL-ytvkk_I24A.text: Trash service.Stopped into this location to order carryout. Needless to say I'll never visit this location again, as soon as I entered a woman at the front was on the phone seemingly having a personal conversation and did not look in my direction as I stood in front of her, acknowledge me, or say she would help me. After a long while  of standing there (ignored) a man came from the back and noticed me and asked what I needed and proceeded to try to take my order...I was so frustrated I told him no thanks and walked out.   If you have another red bowl location go to that one instead.

v_LNqaBm6pRhupI-TKUl2w.text: Good local Chinese!  I have been to the Red Bowl twice.  I must say, I thought it would be the no-atmosphere fast food Chinese restaurant since it sits in a strip mall next to Harris Teeter in Mountain Island Lake. You would probably only go there if you lived in that area or were stocking up at the nearby Walmart. YOU WILL BE PLEASANTLY SURPRISED! The restaurant is bigger than expected with a two tiered dining room.  Both times the servers were nice and attentive to our needs. As for the menu- there was no lemon chicken. I thought that was a staple on a Chinese food menu. Who doesn't like lemon chicken?? I got the sesame chicken instead and it was a little over cooked, which was disappointing. The second time I got the hibachi steak which was excellent.  This place has specials during the week like $4 cocktails and other sushi specials which I always appreciate. I have seen a coupon in the Valpak that comes in the mail for half off an entree which is always a plus.

gw1pP-y81JLNfUgoUK_9jQ.text: My first time at Red Bowl ever....I was pleasantly surprised. The food was a little sweet for my taste but the tea (oolong) was great and the SERVICE from my waiter (STEVE) was outstanding! He was very attentive and provided me with great suggestions and even brought me hot oil without my request (I would have asked).  The food I would give 4 stars but STEVE gets 5 stars. What a great experience.   I had lunch - oolong tea.  Thai Basil Chicken.   Request Steve! You will have a great time.

jYZclPQuARU5seTdfxdu0g.text: I've had the food a couple of times with my significant other and their family. I was not impressed both times. This last time, my boyfriend got me take out sushi, I know that sushi is meant to be enjoyed in a restaurant and not out of a plastic container. He told me got some sort of crazy or spicy tuna. The tuna was subpar and all that came in the roll was the tuna and avocado....which is kind of pointless, not even crabmeat or cucumber base.  The most disapproving point of the sushi was this bright orange thick paste on top of it. It was almost like thick mayo sriacha paste with tempura flakes on top. It was disgusting. Never again.

qq-FQ0Zre8n9Dszp_pPnKQ.text: This is our go to place when we order out! We're from Long Island and haven't been able to find good Asian food until now. We order from here a lot and it's always good and done quickly. Great vegetarian options as welll!!

gMo_5oHU7YOEhrUFAfBtiw.text: I was unable to upcharge my rice to rice noodles. This simple request was met with this response... "Our chef refuses to do that".  I wasn't looking to exchange but to pay for it as a side because I love Asian food but hate the rice texture. Rice noodles are usually a perfect option for me. I ended up having to get a different dish that came with rice noodles which was dry and bland in taste. I'm still confused why they wouldn't do this when I was willing to pay more to cover any extra expense.    Positives: fast service and a pleasant waitress.

2_KScZMsb5VY626qcI3usw.text: For the Mountain Island location: I always have a great experience here. Although I've never dined-in, the carry-out is always fast, the service is always friendly, my order has never been incorrect and the food is two thumbs up delicious! I love their potstickers!

0pY5erOHpthzrPt3z-XU-g.text: My favorite place! I'm here at least once a week! Everyone is incredibly friendly and the food is amazing.

JMWreA4q9Trt987fcF8Lkg.text: I cannot believe the Bang Bang Shrimp costs $6.25 and I had to wait over 25 minutes for my order; I have never received an order with small, almost salad size shrimp. I also ordered the 88 Roll and it was mediocre. Jimmy could be friendlier as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States

WNELKT-pPDL_c2QQDn-_9Q.text: Great Asian Restaurant! Delicious and fresh food for a reasonable price. Great location and beautiful decor

photos.caption: Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great place great food

_reHpqnrMfiAX1VtLSJSQQ.text: Best sushi in town love it you have to try Red Bowl Deluxe sushi roll. Service is terrific. Prices affordable

RcV_vx088z375na7-GqnUg.text: This is a Regional Franchise with locations in North & South Carolina.  This location is just adjacent to the Harris Teeter at Mt Island Lake in North Charlotte. James has been here several times and recommended it.  We each had the Bento Box which is a good deal. For $11.50  you get a salad or spring roll, choice of sushi and then an entree with fried, white or steamed rice.  I had the salad with ginger, crunchy roll sushi, hibachi chicken with fried rice, We also had a pot of Jasmine tea, It was all quite good and the service was very good, Eddy is professional and has an easy manner.  A fair price for a decent meal, it's not exceptional but the food quality is good and the dining room is nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Bento Box, Hibachi chicken

9yMu-u7fCA-kBZ_ijciNwg.text: Our waitress was nice and knew what she was doing. Very good service. The dining area is dimly lighted and nice. As for the food, it was alright...   -The bang bang shrimp is sweet, not spicy whatsoever unless you mean pepper? -Viet summer roll does not have vermicelli noodles just to let you know (but it was okay for me because I prefer extra lettuce)  -Peanut sauce for the roll is salty. No need to dip a lot or its overpowering, it should be sweeter. -Sushi is normal, not bad at all.  That's about it... I'll probably come back to try other dishes --- any recommendations?

photos.caption: Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Decent sushi
Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Viet Summer Roll - sauce is salty; should be sweeter.. there&#39;s no vermicelli noodles in the roll either.

y0e3cE93G3VkLRtz81vgyw.text: I have not been here in seven years but I was not disappointed.  Chicken Lo Mein ordered spicy was great and the Hot and sour soup was on point.  My two friends also loved everything they ordered.  Nice to have a good Chinese restaurant around even if it is a drive for me.

HsZdcbI9V8lNx8ENFwoXBg.text: Hands down best Asian fusion restaurant in this area. The sushi is amazinggggg.. I always get the Red Bowl Deluxe. They also have really great noodle dishes; their Pad Thai and Singapore Noodles are my favorite. The wait staff is also really nice! You will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Bowl Deluxe Sushi Roll

7G5BwbEd200iGpRMGd0sMQ.text: The first word that comes to mind when I reflect on my visit was "sticky". There was nothing glaringly gross or unhygenic at Red Bowl near Callabridge but I feel the restaurant definitely could've used a though wipe down of it's surfaces. Pushing that out of my mind and automatically deducting one star off my review, I pressed forward with my meal. Our server (Tara, a lovely young lady) was prompt with our food and drink orders and the atmosphere was relaxing and uncomplicated. I ordered the Bento box, a relatively popular order from what I can surmise, which came with your choice of soup, 6 rolls, an entree, and a styling of rice for 11.95. The food itself was pretty unremarkable. I enjoyed my meal but wasn't blown away/didn't taste anything that would entice me to return.   Red Bowl is deserving of the three star average it currently maintains. Nothing special; the word mediocre comes to mind but I feel that may have a more harsh connotation for most people than it does for me. It's...ok

Mbr92ZWk5VdNpfVqhYeo1g.text: Standard Asian fair.  Not bad, but nothing outstanding.  Server was pleasant and quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States

tti9_QjQjw1BDfSUQgu_2A.text: I always enjoy coming here the sushi is really good! They are my favorite. Their red curry shrimp is really good. The staff and service are great. Their always so sweet.

RBcOlILlFmvzvoPnW58_cw.text: I've been going to this place for a few Years now. Needless to say service.m, the quality of food and NOW the quality of drinks have declined. Came in today and learned the bartender John quit :( he made the best Long Island ice teas. So I ordered one from the new guy and it was Horrible!! I won't order another drink from them. The meat: chicken and beef in the house lo mein and house fried rice taste "weird"   Besides the sushi here, I do not like the meat. Service sucks because they have maybe 2 waitresses tried to care for 20+ tables and it's not working. I love close by but it's time to find a new restaurant. We use to eat her 3-5 times a week now it's maybe once a month.

uDzcPnWlaxNI4K1Ccvq6tg.text: best food around. i love this place because their menu has so much variety, and is not confined to just one set of taste buds. they have japanese, chinese, vietnamese, and even more food.   i really love their sushi-- i would recommend the "pink lady"!! their egg rolls (chicken with duck sauce) are amazing!! i grew up going here and it will always be a comfort food of mine!! if you're unfamiliar with the menu and it feels overwhelming i would recommend either the chicken fried rice or bento box (which is like a taste of everything). enjoy y'all!!

9je4JT_YDu4Tlz8CEBC4Rw.text: We had lunch there today 4/29/18 because we havent been to Red Bowl in a while. When we walked in there was a smell that was a turn off. Waitress came and took our drink order which took forever to get. When taking our food order I wanted sweet n sour chicken and was advised they didnt have sweet n sour chicken today. Not sure why because harris teeter is right beside it and if they was out of something could have went there and got what they needed but i settled for seasame chicken. My wife ordered beef n broccoli and 2 spring rolls and I had an egg roll. The egg roll tasted like it had been sitting most of the day and was barely warm. When our food came out it was just as awful. The fried rice wasnt good and was like it had been sitting a while. Seasame chicken had a funking taste to it and wasnt that good as well. We had to ask another waitress for our bill to leave because our waitress was missing. When our waitress did take our bill i asked for a coke to go and that never came either. Needless to say today killed it for us going back to this Red Bowl!!!

ClXU-QOvEI4NSMtXX4VtSg.text: There's not much to choose from in this area so I frequent red bowl as they have a nice variety of asian cuisine and a nicely priced lunch menu. They also have a sushi menu.  The food is pretty good. Good enough for me to come back.  The ambiance is also good. Though I personally don't like that it's kind of dark during lunch hours but for dinner it's fine.  The service is awesome. My drinks are never empty and the servers are always checking on us.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Awesome sushi right here!

g0n3FrQc2ahf--4S-_4n1A.text: Ok, ya know what? I had to update & give Red Bowl the 5 stars. Why you ask? Consistency. Options.   Red Bowl is arguably one of the best places for Asian cuisine in this area of Charlotte. Whether you're dining in or taking out, Red Bowl's food has not done me wrong. Also, it's the best option for Asian style food in this area - period.   All the stir fry's are good. They have a full bar with TVs so you can hang out as well. You can dine in or take out. The menu is pretty extensive. I'm talking chicken, seafood, beef, vegetarian .... sushi, fried stuff, lo Meins, fried rice - soo much on the menu. The crab wontons are DELICIOUS in my opinion and the best starter they have on the menu. The staff is generally friendly and accommodating. Portions are pretty big as well. It's a little rough around the edges, nothing fancy & service isn't always consistent. However, one thing is consistent - THE FOOD. Whoever is in the kitchen can COOK.    I would recommend to a friend for sure.

7R_9N2i0kOoeBCd1WSnApQ.text: The willingness to order food 10 min before closing...dont even think about it. I was asked out. Use to order food here often, not anymore..

btkRuqxmwUIYoQlT_O9IlA.text: This restaurant is deceptively large.  Tucked in a strip mall by a Harris Teeter, I thought it was a quick Chinese take out place.  We went inside to kill some time to let rush hour traffic die down and were pleasantly surprised at how spacious it actually is!  The food is ok.  We eat a LOT of Asian food, so I guess I'm picky.  I found the food mediocre.  The sushi was fresh and definitely the best of what we got, but all lacked flavor.  Service was great and prices were reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Thai red curry shrimp
Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dragon Roll
Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dragon Roll

i9M2SOhhMVnuBUSlIBIr2w.text: First time here food okay but service questionable. On a 76.00 order with 7 orders . I requested shrimp sauce and was given 2. The young man behind the counter told me that they were pit but a bottle was sitting on the counter then told me he would have to charge me extra. I new to this side of town and I must say I am missing the service of my previous area.

__kv6N58agoy0AYJGLy4hg.text: Every holiday they SAY they are open, meaning their WE'RE OPEN sign was on. We came in before 9 pm on July 4th and tried to eat. The guy at the front said hold on.... I'll be right back. When he came back...he said... laughing... we're closed. Last time we were here service was terrible. We will never come back.

pAnfZweGDHim6Gkpwz9BfA.text: Great spot if you're looking for a quick, average, Asian meal. I ordered pretty healthy and went with the steamed broccoli, rice, and chicken combo- sauce on the side.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States

fY3fLaplb2LQ3U0SVbjbsg.text: Great Chinese place, sushi is SSSUPER good! 10/10 would come back and recommend! The staff is great :)

ELCFDfkkBzX9rvjvTWJPBw.text: A nice local option for dinner.   We were surprised how lard the bistro was, from the outside it looks like a hole in the wall but it's large enough for families of all sizes and has a cute bar area up front.   Priced right, the menu has lots of options. We decided on crab Rangoon's to start. They came out very hot (always good) and had lots of crab flavor in just a small bundle of filling. The sweet and sour was tasty with a nice pineapple flavor in there. The opportunity here would be just to plate them on a paper of some sort or even just some chopped cabbage, the plate had the oil which isn't a surprise since they are deep fried.   The entrees we shared were beef lo mein and Mongolian beef. Both had that awesome wok flavor I'm looking for with Chinese food. The lo mein could have used some more veggies for some color and texture. It had a nice flavor of garlic and savory all the way through. The Mongolian beef was also good with a hint of sweet in the dish. The dishes were a little heavy with oil but it's normal for most Chinese food. The chile oil was not spicy to us... which was a little sad.   The service was attentive and they worked as a team so that helped keep things moving.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef lo main
Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mongolian beef
Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Rangoon

zblFTrMmWSeA0zQJtufIng.text: This restaurant is one of my favorite restaurants!!!  You can find local Asian food anywhere you live. But this place is a shining gem of a bistro. Great cuisine ready to be devoured.   Everything from the food, industrial style interior design, to the staff makes this place an enjoyable eatery. Not to mention the prices are very reasonable for the quality of food you are served.  Great seating with plenty of room.   When wanting some of your favorite Asian dishes this is a place to dine!

photos.caption: Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spring Rolls
Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef and Broccoli with Fried Rice
Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Egg Drop Soup with Scallions

5r5qbguj0qL3d6P3PT_6Jg.text: Food Taste: 10  Food Temp.: 10  Order Accuracy: 10  Speed of Service: 9  Server Attentiveness: 5  Host Friendliness: 8  Environment: 8  Cleanliness: 8  Restroom Clean: 9  Always good. Always! I must come here two or three times a month. The food is always hot and fresh. I love the chicken egg rolls. Pad Tai is one of my favorite dishes. The Drunken Noodles is a must try. The Singapore Rice Noodles is another fav. The service is probably the weakest link. There are a few amazing servers, but they are few and far between. What a gem for this part of Charlotte that desperately needs better/more restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad Thai

GgUvWcPdwpE3JbljgWIUSg.text: Just tried this place for the first time last night and it was a hit and miss with their food. I got the Vietnamese Shrimp Summer Rolls and the Chicken Red Bowl StirFry w/Teriyaki Sauce.   The Chicken StirFry was delicious. I was looking for something healthy and it was just that: chicken and a bunch of vegetables in a light sauce. The sauce could have been slightly thicker to coat the meat, but it was it was still good. The downside: it was listed for a cheaper price on the online menu than what I was charged. Also, when I finished my bowl I found some fine black grit at the bottom. Hopefully, it all settled to the bottom and I didn't eat any of it .  On a negative note, the Summer Rolls were extremely disappointing and flavorless. It was just a few thin pieces of shrimp and a lot of lettuce. No noodles, sprouts, vegetables, or herbs. If they were present, it was in extremely small quantities and the roll was completely reliant on the peanut dipping sauce (which was ok) to give it taste.   I will say I didn't dine in, but it was well lit, I liked the ambiance, and the staff I interacted with was friendly. Because a lot of the reviews on here were positive ones, I'm willing to give this place another shot and see how other menu items stack up against the Asian food I'm used to having in CA.

CAHRuo8rO3ScUnLfmyPs_g.text: Pretty good. Quiet atmosphere, not too bright or dark lighting. Wide variety of Japanese/Chinese/Thai options. Staff was quick and attentive.    I got the chicken hibachi with a chicken egg roll. The egg roll was mediocre, but crispy and not too hot. The hibachi was huge! Good quality meat, and I like that it had a bit of a sauce and wasn't dry and boring like other places. Chicken tasted like chicken...lol. Sadly had to say that due to so many Chinese places in town with offputting textured/colored meat. Veggies were cooked well and retained a nice crunch. A colorful and flavorful meal.   Nice place to go out with friends, take a date, or bring family. Good prices, and as another user said, it is larger than it looks outside.

0d1Qct8m5HHoDjC_F2dEAA.text: I loveeeee red bowl. We have been ordering from red bowl for years now. They never disappoint. The staff here are friendly as ever, they know my boyfriend John by his name every time he comes in because he was definitely a regular when he lived closer to the location. I always for the most part order the flour chicken and rice. Not your average flour chicken ,it's drenched in a brown wine sauce that taste oh so divine. I never was very fond of Asian food until I started eating here years ago. One of the best!

PUXrzJT667repLIx_-Se-w.text: Called in a Togo order and the owner never placed my order then lied to me saying he did but didn't know what I ordered rushed my food!! Did not apologize for the inconvenience.... thank goodness I checked my order because they forgot the fried rice,,,,paid 40 plus dollars for terrible food and service. And to top it all off His kids was out side playing and cursing.... over priced bs

photos.caption: Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States

JVojzVFzCX7GFv7ezOGYlg.text: I wasn't thoroughly impressed with this location.  We thought this was more of a poke bowl type of a place, but it was a sit down restaurant.  It is located in a shopping center so parking was plentiful.  We were seated rather quickly for a Monday early evening.  That's about where is goes downhill.  Our server was nice enough but the menu unfortunately looks like every other Asian menu.  I had the broccoli and shrimp stir fry.  I don't have anything negative to say, but I wasn't impressed either.  This was  a drive by so it met the intent.  The folks left with full bellies.

ZUAZYaf-wviTWBKMZxiRqw.text: Love this place! Food is always good no matter what you get! Ambiance is nice and staff nice. I recommend getting the spicy shrimp or calamari to start it's delish! The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because on weekends it seems to be always short staffed and takes a bit to get service.

5P346vVluCM6lOZCxwRA8Q.text: Loved the food here especially the sushi. The lettuce wraps were amazing and so was the dragon roll. The service was super nice and food came out pretty fast.

T3aGAtcpMgYzrEc3lGj6MA.text: Looks really nice in the inside with a nice bar area. It can get a little busy up front if ordering to go. I got the sweet and sour chicken with fried rice lunch special and I must say it wasn't all that good. Pretty much no flavor at all!

gbKElqV5UsqdBVTuy9sAPQ.text: I can not believe what has happened. We went on 6/23 for a family meal to celebrate my sons birthday. The seating was good but the meal turned way different than before.....  There were 8 of us including two children. We place our orders at the same time. In about 15 minutes my soup was delivered and in another 15 minutes my salad, then it took about 10 minutes for my wife to get hers......we had two kids and they had to get some of my noodles as they were anxious and hungry too.....  Then... about 15 after the above 2 other adults got their plates however one was wrong and had to be corrected..... now about 45 minutes after order placed, the last two adults got their and one child..... by this time most had eaten some to keep from the food getting cold.  Overall bad experience!!  No more!!

vHKyHhId8OEokyniscxuqg.text: Decent sushi for a chain restaurant.  Large portions at a reasonable price and better than average service.  Seaweed salad was very fresh.  This is my go-to place when I'm home.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Bowl Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States
